column4: i'm having trouble installing ubuntu (or any distro, for that matter) on my new computer
i'm pretty sure it's relatet to the PATA controller on my board
what happens and what errors do you get?
to preface, my mobo is an intel dg965ry . . . ICH8 has no native PATA support
but i get the "cannot access tty" error
or when i install debian, it just doesn't detect the optical drive
ajmorris: from what i gather, if i use a SATA optical drive, it bypasses this issue
ajmorris: i was just hoping there was a "no purchase necessary" work-around
i don't know if there is one
i'll do a quick search and see what i can find
i've seen suggestions for boot-line params including all-generic-ide, irqpoll, noapic, nolapic
none of these worked
whatever comes after fiesty
what version of ubuntu are you trying to install
i've tried dapper (live and alt.), dapper 64, edgy and edgy 64
someone said this "Using 6.06 no PATA devices are found. So
installing ubuntu is not possible if you have only a PATA hard drive.
My SATA dvd drive is detected fine."
figures
have you tried feisty?
ajmorris_:no, i haven't . . . idk why, i have a disk sitting right here, maybe tomorrow, or later tonight.  If that doesn't work, i'll just break down and get a new drive

so feisty will prolly work
